abstract: Facebook says it will soon change how it pays tax in Britain, possibly leading to company paying millions of dollars on its operations in country; move comes as American firms, facing anger in Europe over accounting practices, are rethinking their tax structures.
lead_paragraph: The company will report sales linked to its British operations, mostly digital advertising, through its local subsidiary rather than its Irish unit.

headline.main: Facebook, in Accounting Change, Could Pay Millions More in British Taxes
headline.print_headline: Facebook Alters Accounting, and May Pay Millions More in British Taxes as Result

snippet: The company will report sales linked to its British operations, mostly digital advertising, through its local subsidiary rather than its Irish unit.
